metadata.title: CVE-2017-5088 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input in V8 in Google Chrome prior to59.0.3071.104 for Mac, Windows, and Linux, and 59.0.3071.117 for Android,allowed a remote attacker to perform out of bounds memory access via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5088` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.14.04.1186').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
